summary: This is a letter from Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorneys to Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding scheduling her arraignment, initial appearance, and bail hearing. The attorneys indicate they have been unable to contact Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center but anticipate she will agree to a remote proceeding on July 14, 2020.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The client of the law firm Cohen & Gresser LLP, currently held at the Metropolitan Detention Center, awaiting arraignment, initial appearance, and bail hearing.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, to whom this scheduling letter is addressed.

persons.name: Mark S. Cohen
persons.context: Attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP who is representing Ghislaine Maxwell and signed the letter to the court.

persons.name: Christian R. Everdell
persons.context: Attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP who is representing Ghislaine Maxwell, listed as a signatory on the letter.

connections.description: Mark S. Cohen is an attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP representing Ghislaine Maxwell in her criminal case.
Christian R. Everdell is an attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP representing Ghislaine Maxwell in her criminal case.
Judge Alison J. Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Defense Letter Regarding Scheduling
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorneys submit a letter to Judge Nathan in response to a court order regarding scheduling her arraignment, initial appearance, and bail hearing.

events.title: Proposed Remote Court Proceeding
events.description: The defense proposes a remote arraignment, initial appearance, and bail hearing for Ghislaine Maxwell, pending her agreement.

locations: United States Courthouse, Southern District of New York
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell is in custody at the Metropolitan Detention Center as of July 6, 2020.
Her defense attorneys had been unable to contact her at the detention center at the time of writing.
The defense proposed a remote court proceeding for July 14, 2020, for her arraignment, initial appearance, and bail hearing.
The case is United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AJN), before Judge Alison J. Nathan.
